title: Program Assistant for the Urbantech Program - Internship
description: Urbantech is a tailored 3-month accelerator and innovation program in Copenhagen. It's a non-equity, pilot-focused program for growth stage startups accelerating the development of sustainable cities. We create future-friendly projects by partnering startups with leading firms from across the building, energy and design sectors. Focused on tech that makes cities better for the humans that live in them.We are looking for a program assistant that will join us in running an innovation program for selected growth stage startups within the urbantech space. From day one, you will get hands-on experience working with an experienced team from Rainmaking and some of the biggest firms working on the future of sustainable cities.The program is run by Rainmaking in collaboration with BLOXHUB, and Danish Design Centre.Learn more about the Urbantech program here: https://urbantechprogram.io/Â How you will workAssist the Program Manager on a day-to-day basisPlan and execute event logistics (online & in-person)Â Create, analyse and present weekly surveysÂ Capture and analyse important data to help develop our programEngage with the cohort both in-person and on Slack (community management)Â Stay close to the action at the BLOXHUB communityÂ Your skill set includesExperience in event/project management and an eye for detailÂ Very good communication skillsÂ Fluent in English, Slack, Excel and PowerPointÂ You are flexible and understand the organic and ever-changing nature of event coordinationÂ What we offerA unique opportunity to help run a large innovation programÂ Possibility to work hands-on with 10 urbantech startupsAccess to world-class colleagues across Rainmaking globally and leading urbantech corporate partners to build your networkExperience working in a fast paced and diverse projectAccess to both BLOXHUB and Talent Garden Rainmaking co-working spacesÂ Why you will do itYouâ€™re enthusiastic about the international startup ecosystem and eager to be part of itYou love organizing events in a detail-oriented fashionYou like working under pressure with a multitude of stakeholdersYou like observing and analysing dataInternship period: 16 August - 26 November, 2021The internship is a part-time paid position based in Copenhagen as part of the Rainmaking Innovation team. We are flexible in terms of working hours. Letâ€™s talk.Deadline to apply: June 30, 2021.Questions? Contact Taline Yerganyan, Program Director, Urbantech (email below). For more information or questions please contact us at tay@rainmaking.io

title: Unity C# Programmer
description: Purple Scout is a Scandinavian software development and consultancy company with varied specializations. In CPH, we specialize in 3D animation, interactive Augmented Reality as well as Mixed Reality, Virtual Reality, and mobile applications. Our main goal is to make the best user experiences for our ambitious clients and via partnerships. We want to ensure fascinating and interactive digital experiences are available whenever you want and wherever you want with just the click of a button.We are currently looking for a creative and passionate Unity C# programmer on a project basis at our Copenhagen office. Since we are a small development team, your tasks will include developing AR and VR solutions and other 3D-based applications for various industries as well as design, build and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code.You need to have:Extensive knowledge of Unity 3D, rendering pipelines, shadersProgramming skills in C#, experience with VCSes (eg. Git) and SOLIDStrong 3D math skillsKnowledge of Unity UI and user session management.Ability to work with animation systems and simulation physics.Ability to optimize memory and space usage.Experience in compiling and deploying Unity projects for iOS, Android, Windows and AR/VR Headsets.Building and optimizing AR/VR applications, that render content in real-time, as well as based on mono/stereoscopic pictures and videos.Working independently as well as with a team Identify process and application bottlenecks and implement solutions in within the given deadlinesFluent in EnglishWhat we offer:Flexible hours and competitive salaryDiverse and challenging projects in the fields of 3D animation, AR, MR, VRIn-house and global conferences (e.g. Unite) and events, including meetings in the amazing Swedish HQ.The family atmosphere - we want to get to know each other the best we canFriday bars and fun monthly eventsHardware & software - anything you need to work in the most comfortable and efficient way.We invite you to be a part of the Purple family!

title: Product Specialist
description: Rokoko is a rapidly growing tech startup providing motion capture and animation tools motion for the global entertainment industry. Our customers are top-tier game, film, AR/VR and VFX companies, as well as thousands of indie-developers. We're looking to add a highly motivated Product Specialist to support and develop our growth.You'll quickly become a mocap product expert converting inbound sales leads and contributing significantly to our quarterly revenue goals. As a member of the growth department, within the sales team, you'll be sitting alongside a diverse, ambitious and dynamic team spread between Copenhagen,  Athens and San Fransisco.Responsibilities:You'll provide a top-notch customer experience to all inbound leads expressing interest in Rokoko, through email, live-chat, and online calls;As an expert of our software and hardware tools, you'll host multiple product demonstrations a day for inbound leads, using the opportunity to qualify and up-sell/cross-sell products when relevant;You'll run the full sales cycle and act as a point of contact for customers until they close, and we'll expect you to identify process inefficiencies and implement improvements along the way;As we release new products, you'll work with the sales team to identify opportunities in existing accounts and take a lead on up-selling to expand the lifetime value of these customers;You'll actively use HubSpot, where you'll record interactions, analyse pipelines, and implement sales automation best-practices;As part of the overall growth function, you'll support group initiatives and share your insights to help pursue our overall group objectives. (We use OKRs, by the way!)Requirements:B.Sc. or M.Sc. in a relevant field;Strong stakeholder management skills, with professional experience building and nurturing relationships and facilitating decision making at all levels;You are interested in sales, product evangelism, and preferably have experience in this function;A keen, demonstrated interest in animation, game-development, virtual production, or VFX is a plus;Strong (fluent) written and spoken English is imperative.We offer a competitive base-salary and commission structure.

title: Senior Full-stack software engineer with expertise in React / React Native
description: Are you eager to develop solutions that will have a lasting and big impact on people? Then the job as a Full-Stack Developer at SubReader lets you put your fingerprint on our software stack, helping tens of thousands of dyslexics and visually impaired people to get subtitles read aloud.About SubReaderSubReader is an Assistive Technology start-up company, whose mission is to include people with dyslexia and others with reading difficulties, to enjoy foreign-language movies. Through our app, we enable dyslexics to get subtitles read aloud on their favorite movies and TV shows. The app turns text into speech using the newest text-to-speech technology.We are growing fast thanks to our integrations with Netflix, Disney Plus, HBO, Viaplay, C More, and others as well as our presence in over 100 cinemas in Denmark and Sweden. We also offer our solution for educational purposes. Our aim is to become the de-facto standard for individual accessibility.The jobAs a full-stack developer at SubReader you will help shape the future of the app, enabling us to take the user experience to the next level for our users. Your primary task will be to develop a service that is intuitive and simple to use. On top of this, you will assist us on larger projects in order to expand into new business areas. You will work very closely with our CTO, who manages the stack. We expect that you are a talented full-stack software engineer who likes building products for people with elegant, clean code and that you are able to clearly express your thoughts and ideas to the rest of the team.What are we looking for?â€¢ Required programming language: React / React Native and Node.jsâ€¢ Nice to have skills; MongoDB, Docker, Kubernetes, GraphQL, Swift, Kotlin, and Rustâ€¢ A person passionate about development, and eager to develop personal skillsâ€¢ A Team player who is ready to give/receive inputâ€¢ A person with an eye for UI/UX and experience in design software, but not a mustWhat we offer:â€¢ A competitive and good salaryâ€¢ A lot of responsibility and a solid career path for the right peopleâ€¢ The opportunity to make a massive impact for dyslexics and others around the worldâ€¢ Working within a modern tech stackâ€¢ An innovative and informal work environmentâ€¢ An ambitious startup that is ready to take our product to the next levelâ€¢ Flexible work environment â€¢ Free lunch, work equipment, and snacks For more information or questions please contact us at alexander@subreader.dk             or phone number            60143551

A quick learner that wants to explore and grow with us, have fun, be productive, and at times hard-working.Â We will provide the candidate with mentorship, the knowledge that is required to build a mobile application, and a development plan based on their interests.The position will start as an unpaid internship and if successful, then become a paid position.Some requirements for you to check if you fit the profile we are looking for:Experience and knowledge with one of the programming languages like Python, Javascript, Java, C#...Basic understanding of how databases and operating systems workDown-to-earth attitudeCuriosity, adaptability, and flexibilityBonus if:Are a Computer Science/Software Engineering/Informatics studentHave some programming experience with real-world applicationsAlready have some experience/knowledge with Flutter or mobile development (Android & iOS)Drop us a short message on why you are interested, why you think you fit this position, and a link to your GitHub/Portfolio (if you have one), and we will get back to you.

title: IT Project Manager
description: About usCorpay One is only four years old, and though weâ€™ve grown exponentially and are now financially backed by Fleetcor, a major American AP company, we remain true to our founding values.We are just as hungry and passionate as when we were 5 people in a derelict garage. Curious minds and execution experts will like our organizational maturity, love the entrepreneurial spirit, and stay for the inclusive culture.Working here means revolutionizing how thousands of business owners, finance teams, accountants, and bookkeeping professionals across the globe handle everyday finance tasks like bill pay, expense management, and bookkeeping. We save our customers valuable time by acting as an automated layer on top of their accounting software.About your new teamYou'll be joining our expanding engineering team consisting of a mix of highly skilled Frontend, Backend, DevOps, Quality Assurance and Product team members. Youâ€™ll work closely with Product Program Managers, Customer Experience Managers and Developers.We face challenges as a unit and pitch in whenever our help is needed. Whether we suffer defeat or rise triumphantly we offer honest feedback to keep growing professionally. While the organizational scale has changed, our agile way of working has not.The OpportunityWe're looking for an IT Project Manager who can run global projects with our EU-based engineering team. As we always strive to improve the quality of our product and as our organization grows more complex, we are seeing an increasing need for someone who can ensure that projects are handled efficiently and in a timely manner. Your job will be to contribute to raising the bar of our project processes and the quality of deliverables.You'll be working in close collaboration with the the engineering team as well as with the product team.Your daily works tasksDesign, oversee and implement IT projects with our engineering team aimed at the US marketPlan, create, execute and manage the overall project strategyIdentify and overcome deficiencies in work division and resourcesMeet with engineering team and other stakeholders to improve to internal, cross-departmental collaboration and communicationDrive our engineering team to improve performance to achieve consistently better project results on time and within budgetWhat we're looking for3+ years' experience managing IT projectsExperience with a variety of different project management methodologiesA communicator and a critical thinker with problem-solving skills - you're the first to ask the questions if something isn't clearA high sense of ownership and pride in your, and the teams, performance and its impact on the companyâ€™s successAbout (y)our valuesOur values mirror our Scandinavian heritage. We are humble, fun, hard-working, and inclusive - today our team consists of more than 15 nationalities. We are constantly pushing the boundaries to make sure that everyone feels part ofÂ Corpay One, which is why we hire personalities - not resumes.Flexibility in the work-life balance is a given, and working atÂ Corpay OneÂ can easily be combined with both toddlers as well as teenagers. We work to live - not the other way around. While we have physical offices we support remote work because we do not define talent geographically. Regardless of your location, you can rest assured that youâ€™ll be a valued member of the Corpay One team.Corpay OneÂ is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to maintain and develop our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives.
